tuftsWildlifePathologyRecord.description: Internal view of the distended gallbladder
tuftsWildlifePathologyRecord.otherKeywords: Common Loon, Gallbladder, Gavia Immer, Gastrointestinal
tuftsWildlifePathologyRecord.formalClassificationSource: International Union for Conservation of Nature
tuftsWildlifePathologyRecord.captureDetails: Olympus Digital Camera C-5050ZOOM, Olympus lens 7.1mm to 21.3mm, f1.8 to 2.6 (equivalent to 35mm to 105mm lens on 35mm camera)
tuftsWildlifePathologyRecord.backgroundInformation: The gallbladder is an organ that stores bile, which is produced by the liver. The gallbladder secretes the bile in response to fat entering the gastrointestinal tract during digestion. The bile emulsifies the fat to break it down.
